title: Continuous Improvement and HF Performance
content: HF performance should be monitored through leading indicators (audits, observations, near-misses) and lagging indicators (incidents, non-conformances). Use performance data to drive continuous improvement. Audit HF elements of SEMS regularly. Engage workforce in identifying HF issues and solutions. Mature HF programs evolve based on operational experience.

scenario.story: Near-miss trends show increasing procedural non-compliance on night shifts. What HF performance indicators should be investigated: fatigue, procedure usability, supervision, or workload?

options.A: Fatigue only—night shift is the issue

scenario.explanation: Night shift non-compliance could stem from any or all factors: fatigue reducing vigilance, procedures that are hard to follow when tired, reduced supervision coverage at night, or workload peaks. Investigate all systematically.

openQuestions: What HF performance indicators does your organization track?
